text.title: Talk to Your Tween Daughter About Boys

head.s: Talk to Your Tween Daughter About Boys

p.s: Nobody likes it when their child grows up too quickly .
Sometimes , the only way to prevent this is to discuss things as a family to ensure your daughter knows the circumstances she is already or will face in the future .
Here are some ways to connect and make this as easy as possible .

head.s: Finding the Right Time to Talk

list.item:
Find a good place to talk .
The setting should be private , quiet , and without distractions .
Talking in the living room when both of you are home alone is a good idea .
Try not to use her bedroom , as this is her place to gather her thoughts and emotions .
If you ca n't find a place at home , try taking her somewhere like a coffee shop or a store she likes to shop at , so she feels more comfortable .

item.s: Make time to talk .
Do n't rush the conversation , or lose focus on the conversation with your daughter .
Instead , make sure the time you have chosen is convenient for both you and your daughter , so that you can remove any distractions .
Leave yourself enough time to allow the conversation to overrun .
Your daughter might need more explanations or help with understanding certain parts during the conversation and she might have questions that she wants to know the answers to .

head.s: Being Open and Honest with Your Daughter

list.item:
Talk with your daughter ’s interests at heart .
Telling your daughter you want only the best life for her , she is more likely to pay attention and gain more from the conversation .
This way , you ’ll be sure that she understands where you are coming from , so that she takes the topic seriously .

item.s: Explain the importance behind the conversation .
It ’s important for your daughter to understand why the topic of boys needs to be addressed with your daughter .
If she does n’t know why you are having the conversation with your daughter , she may not spend the time listening to important information .
Be positive .
Do n't be angry when you talk ; just know that she may not understand or believe everything you say .
It ’s important that you are n’t negative with your daughter as this could impact the outcome of the conversation and could change the way your daughter behaves .

list.item:
Avoid going into too much detail .
If you have n't talked about this particular subject before , it would be a good time to dig into it a little .
Your daughter wo n't understand why you 're talking to her about boys if you do n't tell her the truth .
Only explain what you believe to be most important at this stage otherwise your conversation may go off topic .

item.s: Explain the truth from the start .
Do n't scare her , but be open and honest from the start .
If you start to change the truth , this could impact your daughters knowledge in the long run .
Agree certain rules with your daughter .
This is for her benefit and you should make sure that she understand this .
Whether it means downgrading her phone , installing a parental app , or just simply being more involved in who she 's speaking to , let her understand your motivation .
Explain to her that you having knowledge of who your daughter is talking to will be important in the long run to keep her safe .
Ask her about how to be safe .
This is not a one-man show .
She needs to be involved for this to work .
Find out what she thinks and let her give you her opinion on certain ideas .
Ask her questions , and listen to her answers .
Ensure you correct her on any incorrect information to make sure that she stays safe at all times .
Tell her what she wants to know .
No matter how awkward or simple it is , answer her questions truthfully .
You might even want to prompt her into asking questions if she does n't have any .
Make her favorite treats or snacks to lessen the " cringe " around you both .
Remove distractions so that you can focus on the conversation and have an open mind .
Do not be overbearing .
The worst thing you can do is make her feel extremely vulnerable and like she has no privacy .
